text-overflow.name: text-overflow
text-overflow.summary: The text-overflow CSS property sets how hidden overflow content is signaled to users. It can be clipped, display an ellipsis ('â€¦'), or display a custom string.

firefox.notes: Until Firefox 10, handling of text-overflow on blocks with inline overflow on both horizontal sides was incorrect. Before Firefox 10, if only one value was specified (such as text-overflow: ellipsis;), text was ellipsed on both sides of the block, instead of only the end edge based on the block's text direction.

firefox_android.notes: Until Firefox 10, handling of text-overflow on blocks with inline overflow on both horizontal sides was incorrect. Before Firefox 10, if only one value was specified (such as text-overflow: ellipsis;), text was ellipsed on both sides of the block, instead of only the end edge based on the block's text direction.

text-overflow.title: text-overflow
